entries.meaning: The layer of earth that is below the topsoil.
examples: In the few areas underlain by horizontally bedded limestone, the surface soil is dark gray to black and peatlike, and the subsoil gray and marllike.

verbs.description: subsoil (third-person singular simple present subsoils, present participle subsoiling, simple past and past participle subsoiled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To turn up the subsoil of.
